My boyfriend got it and I almost wanted to order one along with my wine. :P The oysters were also very delicious and fresh but out of the 6 we got, two had some grit. It was also super awkward as I was picking shell bits out of my mouth when the maitre d stopped by and asked how we were doing so I had to cover my mouth and just be like, "MMMMHMM, GREAT, THANK YOU" But besides that, everything was delicious. The ravioli I had was awesome. My boyfriend liked the gnocci but said it wasn't as good as his mom's (but that is biased obviously, I enjoyed it and thought it was good). Everyone there was super friendly, attentive (but not overly so) and helpful and made the experience wonderful! Also, at the time of day we went (5:30-6:30 or 7ish) the sun was coming through all the glass windows and it cast everything in such a lovely glow. It was beautiful. I really enjoyed the whole atmosphere and even though the neighborhood outside isn't particularly visually appealing (there was some construction and street cleaning going on) it looked lovely that day from where we were sitting. I definitely want to go again sometime!

MvkkQ42ulIv-9Vafrs_QvQ.review_text: So delicious and great atmosphere! The staff is very friendly and made us feel welcome the moment we walked in. The food is some of the best Italian my husband or I have had.  They serve delicious warm ciabatta bread while you wait. We tried the Caesar salad, Tortellini, and Gnocchi for dinner, loved it all. We asked for a scoop of their vanilla gelato with a shot of espresso, and poured it over the gelato. So incredible! Their cannoli was also very good.  Highly recommend it here. They've been here since 1886. Our server Octavio was really great too.  We will definitely be back.

TSXhE-W7FF2wQA4SBg0EXA.review_text: On holiday in San Francisco and went here based on recommendations and we were not disappointed. Lucked out with live music on a Wednesday night. Service was excellent. We never felt rushed and the waiter anticipated our every need. After dinner we sat and enjoyed the music.   We had oysters and kalamari for appetizers. Both were good, the kalamari portion was huge. Followed with fresh pasta which was also delicious. The wine list is not huge but still a good selection with a number of good Italien wines. Finished off with an excellent espresso.

I9wjC0MrCfMbnXYwYvXCDw.review_text: Truly a special place.  The food is excellent, especially the mushroom risotto.  As others have said and I can verify, the service is really exception.  Quite a neighborhood gem.

GOqIAiMnrcl22H6O1jnmKQ.review_text: Enjoyed a great dinner here. I had some of the best prawns i've ever tried.  Also had a great seafood pasta. Service is excellent too. Good value for money in this price range. I would recommend.

XQGtmO7WkkchOL6gu21M8A.review_text: Great place for peaceful atmosphere and good Italian food, very friendly and quick service. Old style elegant, placed in a hotel easy to get to by walking from the fishermans wharf.

Sg7PA3qI31MRBKwg6SWSjw.review_text: Great food, excellent service, luxurious atmosphere.  Reasonable corkage fee (18 per bottle).   My friends and I went here for post valentines day triple date.  All of us loved our food, we actually couldn't help sharing.  Not a single dish was disappointing, and I think we ordered 14 all together.  Our waitress was an opera singer and we asked her to sing for our table, it was the highlight of the evening.  Also, get the desserts with wine, it is delicious.  Lovely experience.

_xNDDFtqLpbV4x_UuBrgMQ.review_text: Well where do I begin? I naively came to this place because I saw the hype about it on the food channel. Trust me on this one don't believe in everything you see and hear on TV because you end up looking like a gullible fool like I did. Sadly I came here today for my birthday and let me tell you it is not all that. Shit Olive Garden is better than this place. Let me first start off with the shitty service. The waiter comes and takes our order and as he's taking our order he gets a snappy attitude because my cousin is asking about the meat sauce. Then he doesn't check on us, doesn't refill our water, and then proceeds to take our appetizer and doesn't ask if we are done. Then the food is absolutely awful. We waited an hour for our food no joke and when we finally get it it's cold, bland, and just tasted disgusting. Then when they sing you Happy birthday and bring you the dessert you think it's free but they surprise you at the end when they charge it to the bill and your like wtf most restaurants give you a free desert on your birthday.  Well not this place. Lastly not only is the staff snobby and looks down on you in utter disdain but the clientele does the same thing. We walked in and immediately we got that uncomfortable vibe like we didn't belong there. Then the wtf are you doing here / disdained judgemental looks started throughout the whole night which made the experience even more unpleasant. I felt like I had gone back in time to the 50's when minorities are trying to get a meal at a diner but instead get passive aggressiveness and hostility from the staff and clientele. I smell prejudice.  I mean what did I expect when we were the only Latino family there and everyone else was middle class white baby boomers and their fucking parents. Disgusting!!!! Never coming here again. Shitty service, shitty food, and shitty clientele and way to over priced.

XJ9MF-fk1V9KsbZ7jWt0pA.review_text: Had a great time.  Service was friendly and attentive. Would go back.

8AB1Q_opZsnhxt1aLOvx5g.review_text: The owner apologized for the message that was apparently meant for someone else. Again, the food was very good and we had good service.

OyetWwk8Gx46F36rirQ-Uw.review_text: This place is mediocre. It has an old school setting and the entrance is a little odd. You would have to go through the second door next to it and walk through the restaurant to meet host. You'll see what I mean.. The service is a little disjointed and seemed like they had less staff. I had their wine, paso creek Cabernet which was really good. If you like dark, bold wine, I highly recommend that. Overall it was ok/decent.

jrRC8nWzcYUTyLf4GE6UPg.review_text: Truly the best Lasagna I've ever had and a really great atmosphere. This is the oldest Italian restaurant in America. Cool to be here and read the history of the 3 fires. Really great service and food. Also really great rating and quality olive oil. This place is great!

-shHTy1CEmSMPVSehdASaw.review_text: Went to a large group dinner here recently.  This used to be the San Remo restaurant a long time ago.  We were taken to a back room which was perfect for the event.  Fixed price and choice of three entrees.  I was not a big fan of the chicken breast with tomato sauce and olives.  Salad was good.  Service was excellent, considering the size of the group.  I'll need to come back and try the restaurant instead of the banquet.    Flor D'Italia is located very close to Fisherman's Wharf despite not being that close to the water.  Certainly worth dining here if you're staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

5HEbeSrj8CJxw1VGNXV4KA.review_text: This place is Great!  The Service was amazing, probably one of the best experiences I have had in the restaurant industry.  The food is delicious, with a lot of flavor!  I would def. recommend coming here for all occasions.  The people that left the bad reviews are completely crazy, and I would DEF. recommend coming here!

ZT7jXDWQe0qti8RaXezHLA.review_text: Had a group dinner of 30 in private room for business.  All the staff did a great job. Bartender even helped my guests beforehand by giving them excellent service with happy hour prices. Octavio our server and Lalo the manager made sure we all had a good time. Food was very good, atmosphere fun.  Enjoy. Highly recommend if near wharf, but don't want extreme touristy feel.

TG6i2mr4VUHZCmObD_WVPA.review_text: Our last night on a business trip to San Francisco, we decided to try this restaurant that we pass often. Throwback styling with white tablecloths and moniker stemware created a neat ambiance. Wood carving of a gent in a chef's coat was cool.  Service was good. Bread delivered quickly. Olive oil tasted freshly pressed. We ordered fresh oysters and pancetta wrapped prawns. Delicious. Careful of the Tabasco sauce on the oysters. Very strong   Entrees of fresh pasta lived up to the hype of the menu. Pesto was good.  Worth a visit if you want to try something in North Beach that is not Fisherman's Wharf kitschy.

fdJQGLf_ywbROElu7f04xg.review_text: I had great expectations of this restaurant since I had often dined at Fior D'Italia at the old location where Original Joe's is now. Plus, my parents held their engagement party at Fior D'Italia. From the moment I drove up and the moment I left, I was disappointed.  First of all, there was a sign that read Valet Parking, No valet in sight. I waited a few minutes and then decided to leave my car in front of the restaurant (with hazard lights on and the keys in my hands) and look for the valet. NOT A GOOD SIGN. The valet parker came out and finally parked my car.   I walked through the bar and was not impressed. Then I walked through the dining area and it dawned on me that I have seen more exciting dining rooms in assisted living facilities. My big mistake was thinking I'd just give it a chance.  My dinner order was simple and very Italian: A Caesar salad and lasagna. How can that be messed up? The salad was over dressed and not tasty. When they served the lasagna, I took one look and thought OMG! Grossly over cooked pasta with grayish looking meat. Absolutely no appealing presentation..slopped (in lack of a better phrase) on a boat plate.. Tasteless. Seriously?! This is not Italian food and those who enjoyed it must be from another planet.  Service was slow and not very professional (like the valet). The Maitre'd seemed totally oblivious to the diners. I had to ask for my check after not even eating half of my plate.   I was born in SF and this experience really upset me. I know they have changed owners. It is sad that people read about past glories of this restaurant, visit it and have to deal with poor service and even poorer food.

lBaoq2G8xXrSX_esMQXM-A.review_text: Bar hopping on a Sunday late afternoon got a recommendation from a local pub of where to go for snacks and a great happy hour and boy where they right.  Their happy hour was half price on appetizers and drinks every day.  We tried the calamari, meatballs and the steak tips and I rate them in that order.  The fried calamari was barely breaded which meant the seafood needed to be top notch and cooked perfectly and it was, very tender and tasty.  The meatballs were moist and sitting in a hearty red sauce which paired perfectly with the sour dough bread we were given.  Not a drop of sauce was left on the plate.  The steak tips were OK but they wouldn't be something I would order again, the sauce was a bit sour for me.  But I will say we did finish them.  Can't wait to return on another one of our weekend bar strolls in North Beach.

ZjmHqQ_iugiF0GzDFLSkkg.review_text: What a great neighborhood gem! Had the meatballs at the bar during happy hour, very good. Wife and I had dinner after in the dining room, mine was Bucatini, spicy good. She had the Saltimbocca very nice as well. Waiter was excellent, treated us like family. Overall experience was great! I would definitely return and recommend to my friends and family. Thank you guys!

dGtsHOFYxPyJL5qK8k49kg.review_text: A San Francisco institution.  Fior D'Italia is steeped in history, but never forgets what is important.  Classic Italian Fare with a "Cheers" twist.  This is  great place for the neighborhood folks to congregate.  They have an unbeatable happy hour  from 4-7pm every day, with great bar food deals.  If you are hungry for more, there is an extensive italian menu to chose from. Service is friendly,  and bar specialty cocktails like" the Trixie" and the "tiramisu Martini" are not to be missed.  The Bar has good separation from the restaurant, and has an elegant, upscale feel, without being cold or impersonal.  We'll be back, again and again!!

vFYc4WydEzBxgqudfYmtog.review_text: Recently had dinner at the Fior D'Italia after a 50-year hiatus. Much has changed, of course, including the ownership. The food was very good, the service better. San Francisco has several Italian restaurants; a few are better and more expensive than the Fior D'Italia. Most are derivative. The five people in our party each had different entrees, and all enjoyed their meals. My rustic grandniece had rabbit and pronounced it excellent. Rabbit, for cry in' out loud! Poor wee critter.  A few Yelpers here said the staff was rude. Not my experience at all. I was greeted like an old friend. Everything was served promptly and courteously. On the not so wonderful side was the Wednesday jazz in the dining room. The music was enjoyable, but it made having a table conversation difficult. Go another day.

3WgJQAk7MirwvHqSs-VPUQ.review_text: Happy Hour is beyond belief. Fabulous martini's & great appetizers 50%. The bartender Gio, makes a very good, I mean a very good drink. We had a great time at this SF institution.

R6LxLsWWy4WUgvHOegy1SQ.review_text: Fior D'Italia, SF, Ca..3rd location in the past 4 years, now closer to Fisherman's Wharf than North Beach. With the lack of even fair Italian cuisine in Honolulu, we ordered the staples - Prosciutto and melon was B+, Caesar's salad B, lasagna C, linguini and clams A, panna cotta A, coffee B, wine list C (way over priced), ambience B+, service C- (wait staff never removed our dessert plates before giving us the check!)..

3gk1Zmv430gr6x5B7Wjohw.review_text: First impressions are not everything.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet playing on his cell phone (a pet peeve of mine), I had to approach him to ask if he was indeed the valet for the restaurant. Things were not off to a great start, but changed quickly upon our entrance. The ambiance was elegant old school italian, the waiter was charming and knowledgable, and the food was great. I particularly enjoyed the antipasto appetizer, a special that included cantaloupe with prosciutto, and the tagliatelle bolognese (featuring perfectly al dente handmade pasta). In the end this felt like the classic sort of establishment that can never go out of style. I plan to return

UmIPv2IcGQyM6TbF3IlPQQ.review_text: I had an incredible experience. The entire staff as well as the guests were the most welcoming people I came into contact with during my short stay in San Francisco. The food was delicious as well as the wine. Quail with polenta, outstanding, as well as the pasta.  Phil from Boston, Grazie!

BX_HN7TaRrHB-fRqFiyfDg.review_text: Excellent food, excellent service. True authentic Italian food. The best bread!!! Great prices, great house wine. What more could you want!!!

C4HXzu1dG4iIvQ5QNZ_tJQ.review_text: I didn't like it! I didn't like the taste, though they were quite obliging to accept in making pastas and appetizers which we want.

zm7vxpzRUEB3hxDmDIUK4Q.review_text: Great experience.  good hardworking crew working there and new owner. Try the veal parmigiana, still my favorite.

kppBguKirqfI2obSQ15d7Q.review_text: If I were able to give Fior 6 starts instead of 5 I'd so it!  We are a group of 8 and we've gone out to eat together in SF nearly every Friday night for the last 20 years.  Our experience last night at Fior was amazing.  We were greeted by Lalo, the manager, and seated in a private area of the main dining room.  The unhurried service was absolutely impeccable.  We ordered a Zinfandel, which upon tasting was really not to our liking, but we said it would be okay.  The server--without being asked--suggested he take it back and bring us a different wine altogether.  We hesitated but he insisted.  He pleasantly took the bottle away, and brought us a much nicer wine (only a few dollars more than the first).  The menu has many "old style" Italian pastas and entrees.  The side order of three kinds of mushrooms was out-of-this-world.  Everyone enjoyed his or her meal.  The pistachio ice cream and the panna cotta provided an outstanding finale to a thoroughly enjoyable evening.    I don't understand the bad reviews.  We enjoyed it so much we've made reservations for a return visit in four weeks.

L9ZmCfOzeMN1HshgJ49fzQ.review_text: Absolutely amazing dinner!  My boyfriend and I were looking to try a new restaurant and came across Fior F'Italia. Immediately felt a good vibe walking thru the door. The staff is so friendly and the food is phenomenal. From the wine to the app to the main course to the dessert and finally the after dinner cocktail. A tiramisu martini.  To. Die. For. I called my mom to tell her about this place and told me that's where my grandparents had their wedding reception 56 years ago!  That's where that good vibe came from! :)

nqKQczyvryGk0ioZnow2CA.review_text: Everything was great. We sat in the bar for 45 min before our ressie and had 2 great appetizers (ravioli with veal ragu and tomato bruschetta). Then when we sat down, we had cioppino and filet with a red wine reduction sauce and tiramisu. Everything we ate was fabulous, the service was impeccable (Octavio was one in a million!) and we have zero complaints, only raves. Highly highly recommend!

KSVXQY7qC32tIWGaXREkng.review_text: Our food was fantastic, prices were very reasonable for San Fran and they accommodated our group of 15 people within 10 minutes.  I had the Minestrone soup and the Veal Picatta and both were very good.  I look forward to going back again.

tUwDJr5nc1P-x4_H-1B4mg.review_text: This place is amazing. The happy hour is every day with great food and drinks for reasonable prices. The staff is always welcoming and friendly. The ambiance is charming and warm. Gio is always in a great mood and recommends the best cocktails. If you're into Italian or maybe just a lush- come here first!

Ime4BTI6TY1WC37UO5OOFg.review_text: Service was good! The portions were ridiculous small for the price. Told the waiter he sent the owner over, an older guy came over and said that is the portion. I explained to him I'm in The restaurant business and it's ridiculous to serve two small pieces for that amount. Server told me they have multiple problems with this. Owner needs to retire he is out of touch.    -Don Alonzo (dined here one Jan 20 2014)

wKWUbNmLHa0XqTBCWcw6xw.review_text: I recommend happy hour.  1/2 off all drinks and bar food from 4-7pm everyday.   Unfortunately happy hour was the best part of the meal, our dinner was just ok, nothing spectacular.  I ordered the Linguini Con Vongole.  The sauce had way to much oil and not a lot of flavor.  I tried my girlfriends Chicken Marsala which they made special for her so extra star for the service.  The sauce was good but the chicken was overcooked and chewy.    The menus seem like something the Olive Garden would hand you.  They are one piece of paper front and back with some colorful design on them.  Very cheesy.  It is just weird for a restaurant that has been around as long as this place.  I expect a nice menu in a nice leather case or similar.    I'm sad to say, we will not be going back anytime soon.  Its unfortunate because this place used to be so good.

QZ57c705ZYoGe9wIKJLEUw.review_text: My husband and I love coming to Fior D'Italia. It's near our apt so we like coming here on lazy Sunday nights when we don't feel like cooking. It's all about the HAPPY HOUR! Every day from 4-7pm. The food menu is just OK. I feel like the portions are very small (making up for the small price) and I haven't found anything that is as delicous as the full-priced pastas. But it's all about the HALF OFF drinks! All beer, wine, and cocktails are half off. Including top shelf alcohol.  FOOD: They have many homemade pastas. My favorite is the pesto pasta. A nice al dente pasta with a very good pesto sauce.   DRINKS: Again, come here for happy hour to get half off drinks.  SERVICE: We love coming here and are always welcomed with open arms and often a hug from Gio (one of the bartenders/servers). The rest of the staff are always super nice and friendly too. I love that they are in nice black pants, white shirt, vests, aprons, etc. Very classy.  This is the oldest Italian restaurant in the city (though not the original location). I love the old school ambiance here.

bJ8H2x_b4FWjzKGoDxbgEA.review_text: On a bus trip to San Francisco.  Our tour guide suggested this wonderful place.  Bar food half price during Happy Hour which is 4:00 - 7:00.  Shared 8 items that were excellent.  Very friendly.  Excellent service.

AJ1uUvxNkDPtz0qHUWuPog.review_text: I thought this place would be more packed after appearing on TV, but San Franciscans aren't stupid. Our cab driver didn't even know where it was. On our way to this restaurant we passed a trattoria, and our cab driver assured us that they are the best italian in San Francisco, he was right.   . Bad service, enough said.  Pros: The frog legs are pretty good.
